title.native: 擾乱 THE PRINCESS OF SNOW AND BLOOD
title.romaji: Jouran: THE PRINCESS OF SNOW AND BLOOD
title.english: JORAN THE PRINCESS OF SNOW AND BLOOD

description:
The year is 1931. Prince Tokugawa Yoshinobu is 94 years old and holds absolute control over Japan. Remnants of the Meiji era’s culture can be seen around the city, but scientific technology and Japanese esoteric cosmology Onmyodo are also developing, exuding a sense of modernity. Yet lurking behind the glitz is Kuchinawa, a dissident group planning the assassination of the prince, and effectively the fall of the regime. Tasked to extinguish these dissidents is Nue, the government’s secret executioner group. Sawa Yukimura, who works for this organization, suffered from an early age at the hands of the Kuchinawa boss. Her entire family was murdered and she dedicated her life to avenging their death.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: The show streamed the episodes on Hulu a week earlier than TV. The regular TV broadcast started on April 7, 2021.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description: __Kudou Susumu__ is a director and storyboard artist.

RAISE A SUILEN is an all-girl band in the BanG Dream! franchise. The group consists of five members:
- [Raychell](https://anilist.co/staff/137051/Raychell) (as [LAYER](https://anilist.co/character/136983/Rei-Wakana)) on lead vocals and bass
- [Riko Kohara](https://anilist.co/staff/120173/Riko-Kohara) (as [LOCK](https://anilist.co/character/133744/Rokka-Asahi)) on guitar
- [Natsume](https://anilist.co/staff/137052/Natsume) (as [MASKING](https://anilist.co/character/136984/Masuki-Satou)) on drums
- [Reo Kurachi](https://anilist.co/staff/137053/Reo-Kurachi) (as [PAREO](https://anilist.co/character/136985/Reona-Nyubara)) on keyboard
- [Risa Tsumugi](https://anilist.co/staff/137054/Risa-Tsumugi) (as [CHU²](https://anilist.co/character/136986/Chiyu-Tamade)) as DJ

They were tentatively given the name THE THIRD(仮) before getting their official name. The group was initially formed as a backup band for the vocalists of Afterglow, Pastel*Palettes, and Hello, Happy World! due to them being unable to play their characters' instruments. It was then revealed during the second live that THE THIRD has officially become part of the franchise, along with a new name, RAISE A SUILEN, and a newly recruited member, Risa Tsumugi.
